author: Staff Reporter
text:
A mentally disturbed man was beaten to death allegedly by the police in the Ranitala area of West Bengal’s Murshidabad district.

Kanchan Seikh (40), a resident of the Bhagwangola area, is said to have wandered into Ranitala, about seven km away, on Thursday morning.

“A patrolling team of the Ranitala police station spotted him and questioned him. As the police personnel were not satisfied with his answers, they brutally assaulted him,” Swapan Sanyal, local human rights activist and central committee member of the Association for Protection of Democratic Rights told The Hindu . He alleged that after the assault, the police personnel dumped the “severely injured” Mr. Seikh near a roadside bush. He remained there for the rest of the night. On Friday evening, his family members found him.

“Mr. Seikh died in a local hospital on Friday night,” said Mr. Sanyal. Mr. Seikh is survived by wife, two sons and a daughter. He used to run a shop before he was diagnosed with psychiatric problems two years back.

Superintendent of Police, Murshidabad, C. Sudhakar, termed the reports “false.”

APDR’s State vice-president Nilanjan Dutta said deaths owing to police torture were on the rise in West Bengal in recent years.
title: Mentally disturbed man allegedly beaten to death by police
